designScenario.name: Protection System
designScenario.description: This design scenario outlines the Protection System for an aircraft, focusing on safeguarding against fire, structural failures, environmental hazards, and unauthorized intrusions. The system integrates real-time threat detection, structural health monitoring, and environmental control modules, designed with robust redundancy and fail-safe mechanisms to ensure passenger and crew safety under extreme conditions.

details.description: Detect fire, smoke, structural breaches, and unauthorized intrusions through distributed sensors and real-time analysis.
Initiate protective actions such as deploying fire suppressants, sealing breached compartments, or isolating faulty systems.
Achieve threat detection accuracy of 99.9% under normal operational conditions.
Ensure sensor data updates at intervals no greater than 200 milliseconds for real-time threat analysis.
Maintain quad-modular redundancy in critical subsystems to prevent single points of failure.
Implement automatic system isolation and fallback modes for degraded operation during component failures.
Provide diagnostic interfaces for ground crews with self-test capabilities and modular component replacement.
Support remote firmware updates and configuration changes via secure aviation data links.

systemComponents.name: Threat Detection Unit
systemComponents.description: Monitors for fire, smoke, structural anomalies, and unauthorized access via integrated sensor arrays.

subComponents.name: Fire and Smoke Sensor Array
subComponents.description: Combines infrared, optical, and ionization sensors for fire/smoke detection.

subComponents.name: Intrusion Detection Subsystem
subComponents.description: Uses pressure differentials and motion sensors to detect unauthorized access.

systemComponents.name: Structural Integrity Monitor
systemComponents.description: Continuously evaluates aircraft structural health, including wings, fuselage, and landing gear.

subComponents.name: Stress and Vibration Sensors
subComponents.description: Measures material stress and vibration patterns to detect structural degradation.

subComponents.name: Cabin Pressure Sensor Array
subComponents.description: Monitors cabin pressure to prevent decompression events.

systemComponents.name: Central Protection Controller
systemComponents.description: Processes data from all subsystems to execute protective protocols and coordinate system responses.

systemComponents.name: Safety Actuation System
systemComponents.description: Executes protective actions such as deploying fire suppressants, sealing compartments, or activating emergency gear.

subComponents.name: Fire Suppression Actuator
subComponents.description: Controls release of extinguishing agents in fire-affected zones.

subComponents.name: Compartment Isolation Mechanism
subComponents.description: Automatically seals breached areas to contain hazards.

systemComponents.name: Environmental Protection Module
systemComponents.description: Manages cabin environmental conditions during emergencies, including temperature and oxygen levels.

subComponents.name: Cabin Pressure Regulator
subComponents.description: Maintains safe cabin pressure during altitude changes or breaches.

subComponents.name: Temperature Control System
subComponents.description: Regulates cabin temperature to mitigate heat-related hazards.

relationships.description: The Central Protection Controller aggregates threat detection data to trigger protective actions.
The Central Protection Controller uses structural health data to initiate emergency protocols.
The Safety Actuation System depends on commands from the Central Protection Controller to execute actions.
The Environmental Protection Module relies on structural data to adjust cabin conditions safely.
The Intrusion Detection Subsystem is a core component of the Threat Detection Unit.
The Cabin Pressure Regulator is an integral part of the Environmental Protection Module.

attributes.name: responseTime
attributes.description: Maximum allowable time from threat detection to system response initiation.

attributes.name: redundancyLevel
attributes.description: System redundancy level ensuring no single point of failure in critical subsystems.

attributes.name: MTBF
attributes.description: Mean time between failures for the Central Protection Controller.

attributes.name: sensorUpdateInterval
attributes.description: Maximum allowable interval between sensor data updates for real-time analysis.

attributes.name: pressureTolerance
attributes.description: Operating pressure range for structural integrity monitoring.

attributes.name: fireSuppressionCoverage
attributes.description: Required deployment speed and coverage area for fire suppression systems.

comments.body: Monitors fire, structural integrity, and environmental hazards with fail-safe mechanisms.
